It's dark, no one on the street awake.
The door to the master bedroom SQUEAKS open and Miranda
quietly steps out, closing the door behind her.  She walks to
the attic pull-down and tugs on the cord. It's a little old
and CREAKY and the sound makes her wince.
As soon as the stairs are down, Miranda hesitates, looking
around to see if anyone else has awoken. When the house
remains quiet, she starts to climb the stairs.
As soon as Miranda's in the attic, she pulls up the stairs
behind her before pulling on the overhead light.
It's dingy up here, as you'd expect, remnants of their life
together. Cobwebby boxes and old bikes, Christmas
decorations.  But Miranda ignores it all and heads for the
built-in seat in front of the window.
Miranda pries the lid off the seat. Inside, several neatly-
stacked boxes and one duffel bag.
Miranda pulls out the duffel bag and opens it, rifling
through a few spare outfits, past several bundles of cash
(thousands), her hand pausing on a passport.
She flips it open, seeing her picture along with the name
"LUCY BAILEY."  The next passport reads "HEATHER OXFORD".
Miranda SIGHS deeply, seeming angry. She's been on the run
for quite some time.  She tosses the passports back in the
bag and nestles it back in her hiding place.
Closing the lid of the bench, she sits down and pulls a
disposable CELL PHONE out from her pocket.
It's cheap, far different than the one we've seen her use.
